description.narrative: Saham Finances currently operates in the two regions of the world which have the lowest insurance penetration globally. In sub-Saharan Africa, Colina is present in countries in West and Central Africa which significantly lag the rest of the region. This investment will allow Saham Finances to (a) consolidate its 2010 acquisition of Colina and leverage synergies with CNIA SAADA; (b) provide growth capital to Colina to further expand its insurance activities in Southern and Eastern Africa through targeted acquisitions, in countries that are markedly under-penetrated; and (c) meet the expected growing demand for insurance products in Morocco as a result of the "Contrat-Programme 2011-2015", a public-private partnership intended to boost penetration rates of non-life and life insurance.

The proposed project involves an equity investment in Saham Finances (Saham Finances or the Company). Saham Finances is an insurance holding company with operations in Morocco (through its majority owned subsidiaries CNIA SAADA and Isaaf), and Sub-Saharan Africa (through its wholly-owned subsidiary Colina). CNIA SAADA is the third largest insurance company in Morocco in terms of premiums with a market share of 13.6% (as of 2010), offering life and non-life insurance products. Isaaf Mondial Assistance is an assistance company (vehicle, medical and travel assistance) with a 46% market share (as of 2010). Colina, acquired by the Company in 2010, is the third largest insurance group in the West and Central African region in terms of premiums, with a 13.2% market share (as of 2009), also offering life and non-life insurance products. The project is intended to support Saham Finances in its expansion strategy for Colina in Sub-Saharan Africa.

name.narrative: Saham Finances is headquartered in Casablanca, Morocco and has operations in the North African and Sub-Saharan Africa regions. The Company operates through its subsidiaries in Morocco, Cote dIvoire, Senegal, Cameroon, Togo, Benin, Gabon, Mali, Burkina Faso, Madagascar and Ghana.
